page.title: 01WISBOROUGH GREEN
page.content: This area contains the southern half of Wisborough Green, population 1300. The A272, main road, between Petworth and Billingshurst, carries traffic past the attractive village pond. The village is dominated by a small hill, on which stands the church of St. Peter ad Vincula and commands views of the surrounding countryside. The area is drained by the River Arun which winds its way through farmland - some pasture, some arable - interspersed with woodland. Attractive old houses in the Wealden vernacular, built in brick, tile-hung or weatherboards, some roofed in Horsham stone, border the road. To the West is the Zoar Chapel, built in 1753, with its own small graveyard. The few shops are sufficient to supply th daily needs of villagers.
